results.title: Trinidad & Tobago Football: Eligibility Law Changes May Broaden Talent Pool
results.summary: TTFA president Kieron Edwards is optimistic about proposed changes to the eligibility law, potentially expanding the senior men’s football team's talent pool by allowing players with grandparents from TT to represent the country. The Ministry of Sport and Youth Affairs has advanced documentation for the legislative amendment. Edwards said the TTFA remains fully committed to supporting head coach Dwight Yorke's squad choices. This initiative reflects a strategic effort to strengthen the national team, but discernment is needed to ensure alignment with biblical principles of national identity and purpose (Acts 17:26).

results.title: Trinidad: Residents Relive ‘Frightening’ Ramco Blaze
results.summary: A powerful explosion at Ramco Industries Ltd’s San Fernando facility left four workers hospitalized and residents traumatized. The blaze, started by a disconnected tank truck, prompted calls for an emergency evacuation plan. Gregory Lange, a resident, described a "huge fireball," while his wife, Teckler Wellington-Lange, recounted fleeing their home in fear. Ramco assured the community of their safety and is working with authorities to investigate the incident. This event underscores the need for safety and preparedness, reminding us to seek God's protection in times of crisis (Psalm 46:1).

results.title: Swaratsingh Dismisses PNM’s Claim of Rising Unemployment
results.summary: Minister Kennedy Swaratsingh refutes claims by former finance minister Colm Imbert (PNM) of a sharp rise in unemployment under the new UNC administration. Imbert alleged a spike from 4% to 7% post-election, attributed to cuts in CEPEP and reforestation programs. Swaratsingh cites Central Statistical Office (CSO) data indicating a 4.9% unemployment rate as of April 2025. The article highlights political tensions and economic data interpretation, but lacks spiritual or biblical context.

results.title: Trinidad and Tobago Government to Expand Skills Training Programmes
results.summary: Minister Prakash Persad announced the government's plan to expand and certify skills training programs, including cosmetology and massage therapy. This initiative contrasts with claims by Opposition Leader Pennelope Beckles regarding the suspension of Youth Training and Employment Partnership Programme (YTEPP) programs. Beckles highlighted the PNM's previous youth development efforts and expressed concern over potential program disruptions under the current administration. "When the UNC got into office in 2010, one of the first things they did was close down all the youth camps."

results.title: Trinidad and Tobago Team Selected for Caribbean Junior Golf Champs
results.summary: The Trinidad and Tobago Golf Association (TTGA) has selected an eight-member team for the 2025 Caribbean Amateur Junior Golf Championships. TTGA president Robin Lewis expressed confidence in the young squad, emphasizing integrity and excellence, values aligned with Christian character. "This tournament is not just about scores – it’s about building character, fostering regional unity and inspiring the next generation."

title: Trinidad & Tobago Football: Eligibility Law Changes May Broaden Talent Pool
